intro: Cyphostemma vogelii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to elongated, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaves, and a unique, branching pattern that aids in its climbing habit. Cyphostemma vogelii is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
